meta.description: Build HTML emails with a drag-and-drop interface
meta.title: HTML Email Builder

buildingAnEmail.title: Building an email
buildingAnEmail.description: With this tool, using a drag-and-drop interface and predefined blocks, you can build an HTML email template that is safe to use in email clients.

previewMode.title: Preview mode
previewMode.description: The result is responsive. Using the preview mode, you can see what the email will look like on different devices.

saveChanges.title: Save changes
saveChanges.description: The generated MJML markup gets translated into HTML, which you can use in your emails. The project state is saved in a JSON file.

copyToOutlook.title: Copy to Outlook
copyToOutlook.description: To paste the email into Outlook, click "Copy document" and paste the contents into a new message. If the formatting looks wrong, search for the option "Set default paste" and set "Pasting from other apps" to "Keep source formatting".

saveAs.title: Save as
saveAs.description: Use this button to save your project as a file on your disk. This file contains all the assets that you're using in the project and can be imported back into the app. Your changes will also be automatically saved in the browser to prevent data loss.

styleComponents.title: Style components
styleComponents.description: You can customize the styling of a component using the settings in this panel.

editHTMLAttributes.title: Edit HTML attributes
editHTMLAttributes.description: In this panel, you can change the HTML attributes of a component, for example the alt attribute to provide alt text for images or the href attribute to turn something into a link.

viewLayers.title: View layers
viewLayers.description: This panel shows the layer view. This can be useful when trying to locate a layout issue.

addBlocks1.title: Add blocks
addBlocks1.description: This panel contains all the blocks that you can add into the document.

addBlocks2.title: Add blocks
addBlocks2.description: You can drag the blocks into the email. Generally, sections with text and images should be wrapped in columns.

addImages.title: Add images
addImages.description: You can provide source URLs for the images, or upload them from your drive directly. In that case, they will be scaled to a maximum resolution and embedded into the document. To keep the size of the document lower, it is recommended to host the images somewhere else and only provide the URLs.

addTables.title: Add tables
addTables.description: Tables aren't responsive, but guarantee that the columns won't collapse into rows. Tables only accept components from the Table section. When working with tables, it may be convenient to toggle on component borders in the Toolbar.
